message: And header links on tag listing pages!
The Default app now has better tabbed formatting, and has been cleaned up just a little.
page!
Kynetx sites now have common basement navigation.
App listings now have clickable tags for navigating to similar apps.
Apps now have a 'contact the developer' link that users can use to report bugs or request features, or just to say 'Hey, your app is nice!'
And recommended apps that you haven't installed on the subscriptions pag!
And general awesomenes on the order of n(log(n))

Hello there
sweetness!

as a side note, if you console.log something in the firefox 4 kbx, it also shows up in the error console. You can also do console.info, warn, etc. https://jetpack.mozillalabs.com/sdk/1.0b5/docs/dev-guide/addon-development/globals.html#console
In order to turn this feature on and off
With the release of Kynetx For Firefox 1.8, you can now see your KRL application logging in the Firefox Error Console (toos -> error console)
you have to add a key to your about:config called 'KYNETX_UBX_debug_mode'
@alexkolson Huge KBX Developer Tool! You have Rock'd my world. Thank you sir
I agree with @Ed... life just got easier.
Bleh. Don't know why convore quoted that.
But yeah.

So I was poking around the Chrome extension to see what it would take to add the debug stuff...and blam! It's already there. 

Maybe you already knew that, but you can make your apps output logging to the standard chrome console by going to your extensions page at chrome://extensions and clicking options on your KBX in the list. From there click the period at the end of 'Kynetx Inc' and then check the box that says 'Debug Mode.'  Your apps will now output logging

Don't know if we already knew that but I sure didn't and now we know you can debug your apps in all of the KBX's! :)
As of tonight you can now see how many subscriptions each of your apps has in the appbuilder listing and order your apps (descending or ascending) by the number of subscriptions
lovely
@alexkolson Brilliant Sir, simply brilliant! Thank you!

Your session on apps.kynetx.com will now stick around for 2 weeks without you having to login again if you check the box remember me on the login form. If you login with fb or goog, it should already be sticking around
Hey there

@alexkolson: some quick feedback on FF. I can't judge if KRL application logging appearing in the console is useful because for me everything appears like a huge string with lots of  \r\n so it's not readable. If I use console.error() the output is printed in the message tab (i)of the console so it's "lost" in tons of other messages including "warnings" and "messages" so it's pretty much useless for me. A good step forward would be to have console.error() printing in the error tab but I think it would be even more natural to have the messages printed in Firebug instead.

@alexkolson: on chrome. The only way to disable debug mode is to uninstall the extension. If the "save" button in the options page was not disabled when debug mode is unchecked then it might be possible to save this state and avoid a desinstallation.
Also: Chrome already had that behavior, so this will bring feature parity.
@TelegramSam Good to know. I probably should not continue to use a deprecated feature.

The Firefox extension that is generated from the extension factory (not the KBX) no longer plants tags into iFrames. This was causing a bug with rich text editors, and also brings the FF factory extension to parity with the Chrome factory extension.
@TelegramSam Ouch! That breaks the app I'm building for Spectrum. Need to find a way to plant tags in all iFrames on a page ASAP!
@edorcutt This only affects newly generated browser extensions. If you already have the generated extension, it will continue to work.
We will be adding a way to intentionally handle iFrames, but we needed to solve the rich text edit problem.
@loic The save button disabled issue with debug checkbox has been fixed and will go out in the next Chrome KBX update
yes, i remember, it was putting strange data in the wordpress rich text editor, great that is fixed

Just released: Update your Chrome Extension (1.34), then you can trigger your own apps in your subscription list to the dev version. In less then 60 seconds, you are running a dev version of the app!
Release Note: This is only for the extension you get from apps.kynetx.com. The other extensions (such as chrome store) will be updated after a shortish burn-in period.
dev apps have (dev) at the end, and disabled apps are crossed out.

Chrome update: new icons, internal changes to do better in-browser filtering of events. Better filtering gives a more accurate "running now" list. :) This one was big enough, we reved to v 2.0.0
